Uljeb.title: Association of Electric Bicycle Enthusiasts
Uljeb.description: ULJEB is an association dedicated to the development and promotion of electric bicycles as a sustainable, healthy, and accessible mode of transportation in cities across Serbia.
Uljeb.visionExtended: We believe that cities can become quieter, cleaner, and more pleasant places to live — with fewer cars, more bicycles, and smart energy solutions. Electric bicycles are not just for recreation; they represent a realistic alternative for everyday transportation, especially in urban environments.
Uljeb.whatWeDoDesc: Through our activities, we connect sustainable mobility, renewable energy, and public space. Our focus is on practical and visible solutions that citizens can use immediately.
Uljeb.whatWeDoListIntro: Our key areas of work include:
whatWeDoList: promoting the use of electric bicycles
developing solar-powered e-bike charging stations in public spaces
cooperating with local governments, companies, and institutions
educating citizens about the benefits of sustainable mobility and energy efficiency
Uljeb.solarDesc: ULJEB develops and installs public, energy-independent solar charging stations for electric bicycles. These stations use solar energy, do not burden the electricity grid, and are available to all users.
Uljeb.solarDesc2: The first charging station was installed in Belgrade, at one of the city's most popular recreational and cycling areas, as a pilot project demonstrating how innovation can directly improve quality of life in urban settings.
modelList: ideal for parks, promenades, recreational zones, and city centers
Uljeb.whyDesc: ULJEB brings together people who believe that energy, mobility, and public space are inseparably connected. Our goal goes beyond infrastructure — we aim to change habits and make e-bikes a normal, accepted, and desirable choice.
Uljeb.cooperationTitle: We are open to cooperation with:
cooperationList: foundations and organizations that share our values
Uljeb.conclusion: Together, we can build cities that are healthier, more accessible, and ready for the future.
